IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE, INSPIRE, AND ENCOURAGE GIRLS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO INSPIRE AND ENCOURAGE GIRLS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12 TO PURSUE THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF LEARNING AND CHARACTER; TO CONTRIBUTE BOLDLY AND CREATIVELY TO THE COMMON GOOD; AND TO SEEK A PURPOSEFUL LIFE BASED ON HONOR, RESPECT AND PERSONAL AUTHENTICITY.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED COLLEGE-PREPARATORY EDUCATION IN A SMALL SCHOOL SETTING. APPROXIMATELY 210 BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12 CAME FROM 11 STATES AND 27 COUNTRIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BALANCES INCLUDED IN AGENCY FUNDS PAYABLE REPRESENT FUNDS PLACED ON DEPOSIT WITH THE SCHOOL AS CUSTODIAN.

THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS AN INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO COMPRISED OF DONOR-RESTRICTED AND BOARD- DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS. ITS PURPOSE IS TO GENERATE A TOTAL RETURN THAT PRESERVES THE VALUE OF THE DONOR RESTRICTED FUNDS AFTER INFLATION & PROVIDE A RELATIVELY PREDICTABLE REVENUE STREAM TO BE USED FOR PURPOSES THAT REFLECT OUR MISSION.

PER FINANCIAL STATEMENT FOOTNOTES: MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED SIGNIFICANT TAX POSITIONS AGAINST THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS AND BELIEVES THERE ARE NO SUCH TAX PROVISIONS REQUIRING ACCOUNTING RECOGNITION. MISS HALL'S SCHOOL'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR ALL YEARS ENDING ON OR AFTER JUNE 30, 2013.
VALUATION DISCOUNT ON MINERAL DEED -31,920. RECLASS EARLY PAY TUITION DISCOUNT 24,240. RECLASS SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE AGAINST REVENUE 25,031.
FINACIAL AID GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS NETTED WITH REVENUES FOR F/S 3,397,453. BAD DEBTS 9,879.
RECLASS EARLY PAY TUITION DISCOUNT 24,240. RECLASS SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE AGAINST REVENUE 25,031.
FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS 3,397,453.
PUBLICATIONS, APPLICATIONS, REGISTRATION FORMS, NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS AND SUMMER PROGRAMS MAKE REFERENCE TO THE SCHOOL'S RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY.

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.TypeOfAssistanceTxt: STUDENT FINANCIAL AID/RESIDENT TUITION APPLIED TOWARDS MISS HALL'S SCHOOL TUITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS QUALIFYING FOR FINANCIAL GRANTS AND ARE BASED SOLELY ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS REPORTED THROUGH SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICE FOR FINANCIAL AID (SSSFA) APPLICATIONS. TWO MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO HAVE EXCELLENT ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS. A LISTING OF GRANT RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED AND AVAILABLE AT THE SCHOOL. AWARDS ARE CREDITED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION.

EXPENSES REPORTED RELATE TO EMPLOYEE TRAVEL AND CONSULTANTS WORKING OVERSEAS TO RECRUIT STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE SCHOOL. THESE EXPENSES ARE TRACKED BY THE SCHOOL AND REPORTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING. THE VALUE OF INVESTMENTS REPORTED IN COLUMN F IS BASED ON THE FAIR MARKET VALUE AS OF JUNE 30,2016, IN ACCORDANCE WITH US GAAP.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS WAS BASED ON RESIDENCE OF THE STUDENT WHEN THE EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE WAS AWARDED. A LISTING OF GRANT RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED AND AVAILABLE AT THE SCHOOL.

REQUEST FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE SUBMITTED THROUGH STUDENT SERVICE FOR FINANCIAL AID (SSSFA), AN ORGANIZATION OPERATED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPDENDENT SCHOOLS. MISS HALL'S RECEIVES A REPORT DETAILING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY SSSFA. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AWARDS ARE BASED ON THIS REPORT. IN ADDITION, AN INTERNATIONAL ASSIST PROGRAM SENDS STUDENTS TO THE SCHOOL FROM FOREIGN COUNTRIES. ASSIST ALSO DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THOSE STUDENTS.

THE CURRENT HEAD OF SCHOOL AND DEAN OF ACADEMICS AND FACULTY ARE REQUIRED AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT TO BE RESIDENTS OF THE SCHOOL'S BOARDING COMMUNITY IN ORDER TO PERFORM THEIR DUTIES AND BE AVAILABLE TO FACULTY AND STUDENTS. AS ON CAMPUS HOUSING WAS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, IT HAS BEEN EXCLUDED FROM THE W-2 FORMS AS A TAX-FREE BENEFIT UNDER SEC. 119. KEY EMPLOYEES HAVE SMALL DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNTS FOR BUSINESS USE.

THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT. THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL PERFORMS A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF BUSINESS SERVICES IN THE RESIDENCE, INCLUDING EVENTS FOR EMPLOYEES, FAMILIES, ALUMNAE, AND DONORS. IT IS ALSO NECESSARY FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL TO BE A PART OF THE RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY OF THE SCHOOL IN ORDER TO OVERSEE AND CONNECT TO THE RESIDENT STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES.
A THIRD PARTY ORGANIZATION IS USED TO SELL SECURITIES RECEIVED AS CONTRIBUTIONS. PART I, LINE 10 B: THE NUMBER OF SEPARATE STOCK CONTRIBUTIONS HAS BEEN REPORTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY SUZANNE BAUMGARTEN, DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS, NANCY AULT, TRUSTEE AND CHAIR OF AUDIT COMMITTEE, AND AT LEAST ONE OFFICER OF THE CORPORATION. AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF FORM 990 WILL THEN BE MAILED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE 990. HARD COPIES OF FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REQUIRES EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. ANY BOARD MEMBER THAT HAS A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS REQUIRED TO ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON A PARTICULAR ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MHS USES OUTSIDE SOURCES FOR BENCHMARKING COMPENSATION LEVELS INCLUDING THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NAIS), ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS OF NEW ENGLAND (AISNE), AS WELL AS PUBLIC SCHOOL COMPENSATION DATA. COMPENSATION FOR ALL TOP MANAGEMENT POSITIONS WAS BENCHMARKED IN DECEMBER 2014 USING NAIS AND OTHER INDUSTRY STATISTICS. MHS STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A COMPETITIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS PACKAGE. THEREFORE, OUR PACKAGE IS REGULARLY REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AS DATA IS AVAILABLE, FOR REASONABLENESS AND COMPETITIVE WEIGHT. THE SALARY AND BENEFITS OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ARE SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. COMPENSATION FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES IS SET BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ANNUALLY. THE CONSIDERATIONS AND DELIBERATIONS ON DETERMINING SALARY ARE DOCUMENTED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL FORMS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON WRITTEN REQUEST MADE TO THE BUREAU OFFICE.
VALUATION DISCOUNT ON MINERAL DEED -31,920. BAD DEBTS -9,879.
THE OVERSIGHT & SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.
